Psychology.title: How Bitswipe Helps You
Psychology.p1: They say trading is 20% skill and 80% psychology. It's not usually the lack of chart knowledge that causes failure, but emotions like fear and greed.
Psychology.p2_part1: is a Bitcoin Game and 'trading gym' where you can feel the tension of real trading without risking your money. Experience days of Bitcoin Futures price action in just minutes and gain.
Psychology.list1_text: Practice making intuitive decisions so you don't hesitate and miss the timing.
Psychology.list2_text: Train your eyes to see how textbook patterns appear in real charts.
Psychology.list3_text: Safely experience how excessive leverage can wipe out an account.
Psychology.p3: Whether you're a pro or a beginner, Bitswipe is a great way to warm up your trading senses.

Mission.title: Wake Up Your Trading Brain Every Morning
Mission.p1: Complex chart analysis, checking news, and live trading. Bitswipe is the perfect Bitcoin Virtual Investment platform to wake up your brain and read the market flow every morning.
Mission.p2_part2: Tune your trading senses and check today's crypto news at a glance. The smartest routine to start your day, with Bitswipe.

Basics.title: Mastering the Basics
Basics.p1: Before loading up on indicators, it's good to look at the basics of the chart. Here are three concepts you'll naturally pick up while practicing Bitcoin Futures on Bitswipe.
Basics.concept1_text: Prices tend to bounce off the floor (Support) and fall from the ceiling (Resistance). Buying low and selling high is the most fundamental principle.
Basics.concept2_text: Have you heard "The trend is your friend"? If the price is going up, don't bet on it falling. Riding the wave gives you better odds.
Basics.concept3_text: Long wicks on candles are signs of a battle. A long upper wick means someone sold hard, and a long lower wick means someone bought hard.

ChartPatterns.title: Common Chart Patterns
ChartPatterns.pattern1_text: A head in the middle with two shoulders. It often appears when an uptrend runs out of steam and turns into a downtrend.
ChartPatterns.pattern2_text: An upside-down Head & Shoulders. It's often seen at the bottom when a downtrend ends and turns into an uptrend.
ChartPatterns.pattern3_text: Shaped like an 'M'. It hit the high twice but couldn't break through and fell. A signal that a downtrend is starting.
ChartPatterns.pattern4_text: Shaped like a 'W'. It hit the bottom twice and went back up. Considered a strong bullish reversal signal.
ChartPatterns.pattern5_text: After a sharp drop, it moves sideways like a flag. It's likely to gather strength and pour down again.
ChartPatterns.pattern6_text: After a sharp rise, it takes a breather in a flag shape. It's likely to gather energy and shoot up again.

Advanced.title: Using Advanced Features
Advanced.p1_part1: Want to analyze more professionally? Turn on indicators in the
Advanced.tool1_goal_text: Experience firsthand how dangerous high leverage is.
Advanced.tool1_lever_text: Profits are amplified, but losses snowball just as fast.
Advanced.tool1_liq_text: If your loss exceeds your principal, your position is forcibly closed.
Advanced.tool1_rule_text: In this game, if your loss exceeds your principal, it's immediate Game Over.
Advanced.tool1_text: Amplifies both profits and losses. Beware of liquidation (Game Over) if your loss exceeds your principal!
Advanced.tool2_text: An indicator that tells you if the current price is too expensive or too cheap.
Advanced.tool3_text: Smooths out jagged price flows to show the trend.
Advanced.tool4_text: Think of it as the road the price travels on.
Advanced.tool4_squeeze_text: When the width narrows, it's a signal that a big move is coming.
Advanced.tool4_touch_text: Going outside the band is rare, so it tends to want to come back inside.
Advanced.tool5_text: The default speed is medium. Adjust it to be faster or slower to find your own tempo.

HowToPlay.title: How to Play
HowToPlay.step1_text: Look closely at the shape and flow of the past candles.
HowToPlay.step2_text: You can close the position anytime within 30 candles. Will the price go up (Long), down (Short), or stay sideways (Hold)?
HowToPlay.step4_text: Click 'Close Position' to secure profits. Position auto-closes after 30 candles.
HowToPlay.step5_text: After the game, we analyze your trading patterns.

Tips.title: Small Tips
Tips.p1: Don't just rely on luck; set your own rules.
Tips.tip1_text: Don't fight the flow; go with it.
Tips.tip2_text: It's often safer to wait for a candle to finish than to guess.
Tips.tip3_text: Don't bet everything at once. Opportunities will come again.
Tips.tip4_text: Just thinking about why you got it wrong improves your skills.

Resources.title: Want to Learn More?
Resources.p1: If you want to study properly, we recommend these sites.
Resources.link1_text: Learn everything from crypto basics to chart analysis for free.

FAQ.title: Frequently Asked Questions
FAQ.q1_question: Q1. Can I make real money?
FAQ.q1_answer: No. Bitswipe is 100% a Bitcoin Game simulation. No real money is involved, and profits in the game are virtual. It's purely a tool for Bitcoin Virtual Investment practice and fun.
FAQ.q2_question: Q2. Will it help with real trading?
FAQ.q2_answer: Yes, it helps develop your ability to read charts and make quick decisions. However, real trading has variables that don't exist in the game, like psychological pressure, fees, and slippage. So Bitswipe can't replace real trading completely.
FAQ.q3_question: Q3. Is it more fun with high leverage?
FAQ.q3_answer: It's a double-edged sword! Profits are amplified but so are losses, and your chance of Liquidation (Game Over) increases. We recommend starting with low leverage (1x-5x).
FAQ.q4_question: Q4. Is the candle data real Bitcoin data?
FAQ.q4_answer: Yes, we use actual historical Bitcoin price data. When and which segment appears is random, so you'll have a new experience each time.
FAQ.q5_question: Q5. Do I have to use indicators?
FAQ.q5_answer: Not required. You can enjoy the game just by looking at the candle shapes. But learning indicators like RSI, Moving Average, and Bollinger Bands will help a lot in real trading.
FAQ.q6_question: Q6. Can I compete with friends?
FAQ.q6_answer: Absolutely! After the game, you get a shareable link. Send it to friends and challenge them: 'Can you beat this score?'

GettingStarted.title: Beginner's Guide
GettingStarted.p1: If trading is new to you, it might be overwhelming. Don't worry. Just follow these steps.
GettingStarted.step1_text: 1m candles have small volatility, making them perfect for beginners to learn chart flow. Practice patterns with a faster pace.
GettingStarted.step2_text: Start without leverage (1x). Focus on reading chart flow. You can increase leverage later when you're confident.
GettingStarted.step3_text: Start with Moving Average (MA) only. If the price is above the average, it's an uptrend; if below, it's a downtrend.
GettingStarted.step4_text: Long games can drain your focus. Start with 10 rounds to get a feel for it.
GettingStarted.step5_text: After the game, click 'View Analysis'. You can see where you did well and where you made mistakes. This is the most important learning process.
GettingStarted.bonus_text: Don't aim for perfect accuracy. Even 60% is excellent. Real traders profit with 50-60% win rates. What matters is cutting losses quickly and letting profits run.

CommonMistakes.title: Common Beginner Mistakes
CommonMistakes.p1: Everyone makes mistakes at first. Here are the most common ones. Know them in advance and avoid them!
CommonMistakes.mistake1_text: When the price keeps rising, many people think 'Surely it will drop now' and go Short. This is gambling. Remember 'The trend is your friend'. Riding the trend gives better odds.
CommonMistakes.mistake2_text: 100x leverage is thrilling, but just 1% against you means Liquidation. Beginners should start with 1x-5x. You can increase it later when your skills improve.
CommonMistakes.mistake3_text: Making decisions based on just the last candle often fails. Look at at least 10 candles to understand the overall flow. Don't just look at the tree; see the forest.
CommonMistakes.mistake4_text: RSI showing overbought doesn't mean it will definitely drop. Indicators are references, not absolute rules. You need to consider candle shapes, trends, support/resistance together.
CommonMistakes.mistake5_text: 'Revenge trading'—trying to recover from one loss by betting big in the next trade—is a no-go. Same in the game. Accept mistakes and wait for the next opportunity.
CommonMistakes.mistake6_text: When unsure, you can press Hold, but using it too much won't improve your skills. It's okay to be wrong; be bold and try Long or Short. Learning from mistakes is the fastest way to improve.

PerformanceAnalysis.title: Understanding Game Statistics
PerformanceAnalysis.p1: After the game, various metrics are shown. Here's what they mean and how to interpret them.
PerformanceAnalysis.metric1_text: Percentage of correct trades out of total trades. Above 60% is excellent, above 50% is above average. Below 40% means you should revise your strategy.
PerformanceAnalysis.metric2_text: Shows which prediction (Long or Short) you're better at. If one is notably lower, study patterns for that direction more.
PerformanceAnalysis.metric3_text: Average Profit / Average Loss. Above 1.0 is profit, below is loss. Above 2.0 is very good. You can make money even with a low win rate if your profit factor is high.
PerformanceAnalysis.metric4_text: Average profit (or loss) per trade. If it's positive, that's a good sign; if negative, you need to change your strategy.
PerformanceAnalysis.metric5_text: The highest profit from a single trade. This appears when you used leverage well or caught a big trend. Luck matters, but skill is needed too.
PerformanceAnalysis.metric6_text: Overall return from start to finish. +100% means your assets doubled. Negative means you lost principal. The higher the leverage, the more extreme this value becomes.
PerformanceAnalysis.indicator_intro: After the game, click 'View Analysis' to see your trading patterns by indicator (RSI, MA, BB). How should you interpret this data?
PerformanceAnalysis.rsi_oversold_text: Theoretically, it's 'oversold, time to bounce'. If you went Long a lot here, you have a counter-trend tendency. High win rate means you're good at it; low means you might be ignoring the trend.
PerformanceAnalysis.rsi_neutral_text: The most common zone. Most trades happen here. Your win rate here represents your basic skill. Long/Short ratio shows if you're trend-following or counter-trend.
PerformanceAnalysis.rsi_overbought_text: Theoretically, it's 'overbought, time to correct'. If you went Short a lot here, you have a counter-trend tendency. But in strong trends, overbought can last long—be careful.
PerformanceAnalysis.ma_uptrend_text: Price is above MA and MA is sloping upward. Going Long here is 'trend-following'. High win rate means you ride trends well. Many Shorts means you're counter-trend trading.
PerformanceAnalysis.ma_downtrend_text: Price is below MA and MA is sloping downward. Going Short here is 'trend-following'. Many Longs means you're trying to catch the bottom (counter-trend).
PerformanceAnalysis.bb_upper_text: Price is far from average (high). Theoretically tends to revert to mean, so it's a Short timing. If you went Short a lot here, you have a 'mean reversion' tendency.
PerformanceAnalysis.bb_lower_text: Price is far from average (low). May revert to mean, so it's a Long timing. If you went Long a lot here, you have a 'mean reversion' tendency.
PerformanceAnalysis.analysis_tip_text: It's important to understand if your style is 'trend-following' or 'counter-trend'. If trend-following works better, you'll do well in strong trends. If counter-trend works, you'll do well in ranging markets. Play to your strengths and work on weaknesses!
PerformanceAnalysis.tip_text: Don't obsess over win rate. Even with 40% accuracy, you can profit if your profit factor is 3:1. Conversely, even with 70% accuracy, one big loss without cutting it can wipe everything out. Balance is key.

PrivacyPolicy.title: Bitswipe - Privacy Policy
PrivacyPolicy.description: Learn how Bitswipe collects, uses, and protects your personal information. We value your privacy and data security.
PrivacyPolicy.keywords: Privacy Policy, Data Protection, User Privacy, Cookie Policy, Information Security, Bitswipe Privacy
PrivacyPolicy.ogDescription: Your privacy matters. See how Bitswipe protects your personal data.
PrivacyPolicy.introP1: Bitswipe (https://bitswipe.xyz) values your privacy. This policy explains what information we collect and how we use it.

logFiles.title: Log Files
logFiles.p1: Like most websites, Bitswipe uses log files. These are automatically generated records when you visit the site, including IP address, browser type, visit time, etc. This information is used only for site operation, trend analysis, and improving user experience, and is not used to identify individuals.

cookies.title: Cookies
cookies.p1: Bitswipe uses cookies for user convenience. Cookies store user settings or visit history to help you use the site more conveniently on your next visit.

googleDart.title: Google DoubleClick DART Cookie
googleDart.p1: Google, as our advertising partner, uses DART cookies. This is to show appropriate ads based on your internet visit history. You can opt out of DART cookies on the Google ad settings page.

adPolicies.title: Advertising Partners' Privacy Policies
adPolicies.p1: Ads displayed on Bitswipe are provided by third-party ad servers or ad networks. They may use technologies like cookies or web beacons to measure ad effectiveness or provide personalized ads, and your IP address may be automatically transmitted in this process.
adPolicies.p2: Bitswipe has no control over the cookies used by these third-party ad partners.

thirdParty.title: Third-Party Websites
thirdParty.p1: Bitswipe's privacy policy does not apply to other websites or advertisers. Therefore, please check the privacy policy of the linked site when you use it.

children.title: Child Protection
children.p1: Bitswipe does not knowingly collect personal information from children under 13. If you believe your child has provided personal information on our site, please contact us immediately. We will take steps to delete such information right away.

consent.title: Consent
consent.p1: By using the Bitswipe website, you are deemed to agree to this Privacy Policy.

CookieConsent.message: We use cookies to enhance your experience and analyze our traffic. By continuing to visit this site you agree to our use of cookies.

TermsOfService.title: Bitswipe - Terms of Service
TermsOfService.description: Read the Terms of Service for Bitswipe. Understand the rules, user rights, and responsibilities for using our crypto trading simulation platform.

section1.title: Acceptance of Terms

section2.title: Use License
section2.p1: Bitswipe grants you a limited license to use the site for personal, non-commercial purposes. However, the following actions are prohibited:
section2.list1: Unauthorized copying, modification, or commercial use of materials
section2.list2: Analyzing or reverse engineering the site's software
section2.list3: Removing copyright or other proprietary notices
section2.list4: Transferring materials to a third party or mirroring on another server
section2.p2: If you violate the above, your license will terminate immediately, and you must destroy all downloaded materials.

section3.title: Disclaimer
section3.p1: Bitswipe provides the service 'as is' and makes no warranties, express or implied, regarding the accuracy or stability of the service.
section3.importantText: Bitswipe is a simple simulation game. No real money transactions occur, and data or results within the game are not advice for real investments. Results in this game do not guarantee returns in real investments.

section4.title: Limitations of Liability
section4.p1: Bitswipe is not responsible for any damages (loss of data, loss of profit, etc.) arising from the use of the service. This applies even if we have been advised of the possibility of such damages.

section5.title: Accuracy of Materials
section5.p1: Materials displayed on Bitswipe may contain technical errors or typos. We do not guarantee the perfection of the materials and may change the content without prior notice.

section6.title: Links

section7.title: Modifications to Terms

section8.title: Privacy

section9.title: Governing Law

HowToJsonLd.title: How to Trade Bitcoin Futures on Binance
HowToJsonLd.description: A step-by-step guide from Binance signup to Bitcoin futures trading. A complete guide that even beginners can easily follow.
HowToJsonLd.step1_text: Register on the official Binance website using your email or phone number. Enter a referral code to get trading fee discounts.
HowToJsonLd.step2_text: Complete identity verification with your ID. Deposits, withdrawals, and trading are only available after verification.
HowToJsonLd.step3_text: Purchase USDT on an exchange, then transfer it to your Binance wallet address. Make sure to verify the network (TRC20 recommended).
HowToJsonLd.step4_text: In the Binance app, use the 'Transfer' menu to move USDT from your spot wallet to your futures wallet.
HowToJsonLd.step5_text: Select the coin to trade (BTCUSDT) and set your leverage. Beginners should use 2-5x or less, and use Isolated margin mode.
HowToJsonLd.step6_text: Choose Long (expecting rise) or Short (expecting fall) direction and execute your order. Always set Stop Loss and Take Profit to manage risk.

FuturesPage.title: Bitswipe - Complete Binance Guide
FuturesPage.description: Complete guide to Binance futures trading. From signup to USDT deposit and opening positions - a detailed Bitcoin futures trading guide for beginners.
FuturesPage.keywords: Binance futures, Bitcoin futures, Binance signup, Binance tutorial, Bitcoin futures trading, USDT deposit, Binance deposit, futures trading guide, leverage trading, Bitcoin investment
FuturesPage.ogDescription: Complete Binance futures trading guide. Easy-to-follow Bitcoin futures trading methods for beginners.

hero.title: Bitcoin Futures Made Easy
hero.subtitle: A Complete Binance Futures Trading Guide for Beginners (20% Lifetime Fee Discount)
hero.description: Get a lifetime 20% discount on trading fees. From signup to your first trade, we'll guide you step by step. Don't miss this opportunity!

signup.title: 1. Sign Up for Binance
signup.intro: Binance is the world's largest cryptocurrency exchange. With high trading volume, orders are filled quickly, and you can trade various coins. To start futures trading, you first need a Binance account.
signup.step1_text: Go to the Binance website and click the 'Register' button at the top right. Enter your email address and password. If you enter a referral code, you can get trading fee discounts.
signup.step2_text: A verification code will be sent to your email. Check your inbox and enter the 6-digit verification code. Don't forget to check your spam folder too.
signup.step3_text: To trade futures, you need identity verification (KYC, Know Your Customer). Take a photo of your passport or ID and upload it. Approval usually completes within minutes to hours.
signup.tip_text: If Binance doesn't support your language, you can use your browser's translation feature for convenience.
signup.discount_alert_text: This benefit is ONLY available by signing up via the referral link below. If you sign up directly, you won't get it, so grab it now!

deposit.title: 2. Deposit USDT
deposit.intro: To trade futures on Binance, you need USDT (Tether). The easiest way is to purchase USDT from your local exchange (Coinbase, Kraken, etc.) and transfer it to Binance.
deposit.step1_text: Go to your preferred crypto exchange and purchase USDT. You can buy USDT directly with fiat currency. The purchased USDT is stored in your exchange wallet.
deposit.step2_text: In the Binance app or web, click the 'Add Funds' button under 'Assets' to enter the 'Deposit' menu. Select 'USDT' as the coin type, and for the Network, be sure to select 'TRC20 (Tron, TRX)'. TRC20 has the lowest fees. Then your deposit address will appear.
deposit.step3_text: In your exchange's 'Withdraw' menu, select USDT. Paste the exact address you copied from Binance into the withdrawal address field. Make sure the network is set to 'TRC20'. If the network is different, your coins could be lost forever.
deposit.step4_text: After completing the withdrawal, USDT usually arrives in your Binance wallet within 5-10 minutes. You can check it in Binance under 'Wallet' > 'Fiat and Spot'.
deposit.warning_text: Selecting the wrong network (TRC20, ERC20, etc.) can result in permanent loss of your coins. Always double and triple check the address and network.

futures_intro.title: 3. What is Futures Trading?
futures_intro.intro: Futures trading is different from Spot trading - you're not actually buying and selling coins. You're making contracts based on predictions of future price movements. This means you can profit when prices go down, not just up.
futures_intro.spot_text: You buy and hold the actual Bitcoin. If the price goes up, you profit; if it goes down, you lose.
futures_intro.futures_text: You don't own the actual Bitcoin - you're betting on price movements. You can use leverage and profit even in bear markets.
futures_intro.long_text: Go Long when you think the price will rise. If the price actually rises, you profit.
futures_intro.short_text: Go Short when you think the price will fall. If the price actually falls, you profit.
futures_intro.transfer_text: USDT deposited to Binance is in your 'Spot Wallet'. To trade futures, you need to move it to your 'Futures Wallet'. Click 'Transfer' in the top menu and move the desired amount from Spot to USDT-M Futures.

transfer.title: 4. Transfer to Futures Wallet
transfer.intro: When you deposit USDT to Binance, it first goes into your 'Spot Wallet'. To trade futures, you need to transfer these funds to your 'Futures Wallet'. This is an internal transfer with no fees and it's instant.
transfer.why_title: Why do I need to transfer separately?
transfer.why_text: Binance separates wallets by trading type (Spot/Futures/Margin). Due to the high risk of futures trading, the platform is designed to intentionally separate funds. That's why you need to transfer funds separately to trade futures.
transfer.step1_text: In the Binance app or web, go to 'Wallets' > 'Transfer' at the bottom right. Or find the 'Transfer' button in 'Wallets' > 'Overview' from the top menu.
transfer.step2_text: Set 'From' as 'Spot Wallet' and 'To' as 'USDT-M Futures'. You can easily swap the direction by clicking the arrow button.
transfer.step3_text: Enter the USDT amount to transfer. Click 'Max' to enter your full balance. For beginners, we recommend transferring only about 50% of your total funds.
transfer.step4_text: Click 'Confirm' and the transfer completes instantly. Go to the futures trading screen and you'll see your USDT balance displayed at the bottom right.
transfer.tip_text: Transferring from Futures Wallet back to Spot Wallet works the same way. After trading, moving your funds back to Spot Wallet can help you avoid big losses from accidentally opening positions.

open_position.title: 5. Opening a Position
open_position.intro: Now let's actually start trading futures. The Binance futures screen might look complicated at first, but it's not hard once you know the basics.
open_position.step1_text: Click 'Derivatives' > 'USDT-M Futures' in the Binance top menu. BTCUSDT (Bitcoin/Tether) should be selected by default.
open_position.step2_text: The section showing '20x' or similar at the top left is the leverage setting. Start with low leverage (2x-5x) at first. Higher leverage means bigger profits, but also bigger losses.
open_position.step3_text: There are two modes: 'Cross' and 'Isolated'. Beginners should use 'Isolated' mode. In Isolated mode, only the margin allocated to that position is at risk.
open_position.step4_text: Enter the amount you want to trade in the order panel on the right. 'Long' bets on price going up, 'Short' bets on price going down. Click the button you want to execute your order.

order_types.title: 6. Understanding Order Types
order_types.intro: Binance offers several order types. Choosing the right order type for your situation helps you trade more efficiently.
order_types.market_text: An order that executes immediately at the current market price. Use it when you want to enter a position quickly. The downside is you might get filled at a slightly worse price than expected (slippage).
order_types.market_when_text: When you need to enter or exit quickly during rapid price movements, or when you need guaranteed execution.
order_types.limit_text: An order where you specify your desired price. It only fills when the price reaches your specified level. You can buy or sell at exactly the price you want, but it won't fill if the price never reaches that level.
order_types.limit_when_text: When you want to enter near support or resistance levels, or when you want to trade at a better price.
order_types.stop_text: An order that automatically triggers when a specific price (trigger price) is reached. Commonly used for stop losses or breakout trades.
order_types.stop_when_text: When you want to automatically enter when price breaks a specific level, or when you want to set up stop loss orders in advance.
order_types.post_only_text: A limit order option. When checked, your order is guaranteed to be a Maker order, saving on fees. If it would be immediately filled, the order is cancelled.
order_types.reduce_only_text: When checked, the order only executes to reduce your existing position. Useful to prevent accidentally opening an opposite position.

tpsl.title: 7. Setting TP/SL
tpsl.intro: TP/SL stands for Take Profit and Stop Loss. When set in advance, your position automatically closes when the target price is reached. You don't have to watch the chart constantly, and it helps reduce emotional decisions - making it a really important feature.
tpsl.tp_text: This is where you decide 'I'll take my profit and exit here' while you're still in profit. For a Long position, set TP above the current price; for a Short position, set TP below the current price.
tpsl.sl_text: This is where you decide 'I'll cut my losses here' when the trade is going against you. For a Long position, set SL below the current price; for a Short position, set SL above the current price.
tpsl.how_to_step1: When opening a position, check the 'TP/SL' checkbox in the order panel.
tpsl.how_to_step2: Enter your Take Profit (TP) price and Stop Loss (SL) price.
tpsl.how_to_step3: Execute your order and TP/SL will be automatically set.
tpsl.how_to_after: You can also add TP/SL to positions that are already open. In the 'Positions' tab at the bottom, click the TP/SL button next to your position.
tpsl.tip_text: It's good to set a risk-reward ratio of at least 1:2. For example, if your stop loss is 1%, aim for take profit of 2% or more. Even with just 50% win rate, you can profit long-term.

leverage.title: 8. Leverage & Risk Management
leverage.intro: Leverage is the core and most dangerous part of futures trading. It allows you to trade large amounts with little capital, but if misused, you can lose everything in an instant.
leverage.what_is_text: Leverage means 'lever'. With 10x leverage, you can trade $1,000 worth with just $100. If the price goes up 1%, your profit is 10%, but if it goes down 1%, your loss is also 10%.
leverage.margin_text: This is the collateral you put up for leverage trading. To trade $1,000 worth with 10x leverage, you need $100 in margin.
leverage.liquidation_text: When losses exceed your margin, the exchange forcibly closes your position. This is called Liquidation. You lose all your margin, and in some cases, additional losses can occur.
leverage.example_text: You take a Long position with 10x leverage and the price drops 10%? Your loss is 100% (10% × 10x), resulting in liquidation. With 100x leverage, even a 1% move against you means total liquidation.
leverage.tip1: Beginners should start with low leverage of 2x-5x or less.
leverage.tip2: Never invest all your money at once. Only use money you can afford to lose.
leverage.tip3: Always set a Stop Loss. You can exit before getting liquidated.
leverage.tip4: Don't trade emotionally. Trying to recover losses by overtrading leads to bigger losses.
leverage.warning_text: Futures trading carries a very high risk of losing your principal. Study enough before investing, and only trade with spare funds. Never borrow money to invest.

practice.title: Practice with Bitswipe
practice.intro: Before putting in real money, why not practice first? Bitswipe is a trading simulation game that uses real Bitcoin price data.
practice.benefit1_text: No real money is involved, so you can freely test various strategies.
practice.benefit2_text: Using actual historical Bitcoin price data, you can experience situations similar to real trading.
practice.benefit3_text: By playing repeatedly, you naturally learn to recognize chart patterns.
practice.benefit4_text: Build the mental fortitude to stay calm through profit and loss swings.
practice.outro: There's no rush to go live. Practice enough, build confidence, and then challenge real trading. The market is always open.
